intro: Tabernaemontana stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
